techmeme.title: TikTok launches Smart+, a new AI-powered ad tool that competes with Google's Performance Max and Meta's Advantage+, automating ad targeting and optimization (Digiday)
Google says it will appeal the Epic Games verdict, claiming "Apple and Android clearly compete" and the ruling will cause unintended consequences for consumers (Lee-Anne Mulholland/The Keyword)
A US federal judge has given the FTC the green light to pursue antitrust claims against Amazon but ruled that some claims under state laws won't move forward (Lauren Feiner/The Verge)
US bankruptcy judge approves plan to repay FTX customers; in June FTX had $12.6B, which could rise to $16.5B; FTX is in talks with US over $1B+ in seized assets (Bloomberg)
Experts have long warned "secure backdoor" systems are impossible; Salt Typhoon's reported hack of US ISPs' wiretap systems is a key example of backdoors' risks (Zack Whittaker/TechCrunch)
